groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - OS Overview

OS Overview

Always lead with humans: prompt engineering defines what to do, context engineering defines how to do it, and intent engineering defines why it must be done, including policy, guardrails, and company boundaries. The Workforce Operating Model turns that intent into accountable execution before automation depth increases.

groups.label: Human-First Operating Chain
groups.html:
03
Workforce Operating Model - Humans + Agents as one operating model.
Human and digital workers operate together as one model.
02
Identities - How human expertise is mirrored for agents.
Human expertise is mirrored so agents execute with domain context.
03
Mini-OS - How the business is governed and administered day to day.
Governance, compliance, and control boundaries run here.
03
Value Engines - Where humans + agents deliver outcomes and create value.
Execution runs where value is created in day-to-day operations.
05
Real-Time Business Intelligence - Real-time visibility into what happens in the business.
Live facts provide real-time visibility of status, risk, and performance.
04
Flow of Work - How the Fact stream is executed.
Facts are routed, prioritized, handed off, and closed with control.
05
Cadence - The operating rhythm of the business.
Daily, weekly, and monthly cycles run accountable delivery and improvement.
Human
Bridge
Technical

groups.label: Intent Design Cards
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines the requested task and expected outcome.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Provides facts, role context, and current state for execution.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Sets policy, risk limits, guardrails, and company boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Workforce Operating Model
Turns intent into accountable, role-safe execution.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Digital Twin Value Map
groups.html:
Event + Fact
Events become governed facts.
Captured and structured for action.
Human + Agents
Humans and agents execute together.
Work flows through control and value layers.
The Digital Twin
Business state updates in real time.
Decisions and outcomes stay visible.
Peak Performance
Performance becomes measurable.
Faster outcomes, lower cost, higher confidence.
Fact Flow Lane

groups.label: What to Remember
groups.html:
People First
Humans + agents operate as one workforce model with clear ownership.
Facts First
Work starts from facts and stays traceable through execution.
Layered Operation
Mini-OS controls, Value Engines execute, and RTBI provides visibility.
Measured Results
Speed, quality, cost, and risk outcomes become visible and measurable.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Technical

Technical Architecture

This tab is the technical architecture view for Steps 03 to 07. It defines the control plane, execution plane, intelligence plane, orchestration layer, and operating rhythm that run RealTimeOS day to day.

groups.label: Technical Stack
groups.html:
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence

groups.label: Technical Overview
groups.html:
Technical Operating Chain Scope
This tab focuses on the technical operating chain from Identities through Cadence.
What to Remember
Identities First
Execution quality depends on mirrored role context and authority.Mantra:Start with role context.
Controlled Execution
Mini-OS and Value Engines enforce policy before and during delivery.Mantra:Control before speed.
Live Intelligence
RTBI and Digital Twin keep status, risk, and decisions current.Mantra:See risk in real time.
Measured Rhythm
Flow of Work and Cadence convert execution into accountable loops.Mantra:Run work on cadence.

groups.label: Identity Mirror (Digital Foundation)
groups.html:
Identities mirror human domain expertise in digital form so agents can execute with consistent context, role authority, and terminology.

Identity ComponentTechnical FunctionOutput Artifact
PersonasRole-specific context, authority boundaries, and decision viewsIdentity profile with role permissions
AdvisorsDomain-specific guidance for legal, quality, safety, and riskReusable specialist agent behaviors
SkillsStandard language, taxonomy, and method consistencyPortable knowledge pack for execution

groups.label: Mini-OS (Control Plane)
groups.html:
Mini-OS defines policy boundaries, escalation rules, compliance logic, and override authority for each domain before execution runs.

Technical ElementWhat It ControlsOutput Artifact
Domain rule setsAllowed actions, unsafe conditions, out-of-scope conditionsPolicy bundle versioned by domain
Authority modelWho can approve, override, or escalate by risk tierRole-to-authority matrix
Compliance logicMandatory fields, tolerances, evidence retention, audit traceControl checklist and enforcement rules

groups.label: Value Engines (Execution Plane)
groups.html:
Value Engines execute work across domains. They apply Mini-OS constraints while coordinating humans, agents, and systems to deliver outcomes.

Execution ComponentTechnical RoleOutput Artifact
SystemsEnforce operating models and standard methodsGoverned process template
GeniesExecute bounded tasks with deterministic inputs and outputsTask completion fact with status
StreamsRun end-to-end workflows, invoking multiple Genies and systemsClosed-loop process record

groups.label: Real-Time Business Intelligence (Intelligence Plane)
groups.html:
RTBI converts live facts into real-time visibility, forward planning, and decision support without batch reconciliation delays.

Intelligence LayerTechnical FunctionOutput Artifact
Unified DataSingle live data substrate across domainsOne-number source of truth
Digital TwinState mirror of work, decisions, and outcomesReplayable lifecycle record
Planning / Analytics / DecisionsForecasting, pattern detection, and decision supportDecision packs and action recommendations

groups.label: Flow of Work (Orchestration Layer)
groups.html:
Flow of Work orchestrates fact intake, classification, routing, handoffs, escalation, and closure across human and digital executors.

Orchestration StageTechnical FunctionOutput Artifact
Fact intake and typingNormalize events into typed, actionable factsFact record with required dimensions
Routing and prioritizationApply policy, risk, and SLA logic to assign workAssigned queue or executor with deadline
Escalation and closureTrigger re-routing, approvals, and final closure evidenceClosed fact with traceable lifecycle

groups.label: Cadence (Operating Rhythm)
groups.html:
Cadence turns operational facts into recurring management loops so performance, risk, and improvement are governed on schedule.

Cadence LayerTechnical FunctionOutput Artifact
DailyException digest, SLA risk tracking, workload balancingDaily actions and exception list
WeeklyPattern review, automation opportunities, cross-domain decisionsWeekly review and action commitments
Monthly / QuarterlyPerformance steering, investment priorities, policy updatesUpdated controls and execution roadmap
i
Implementation rule: each step must emit facts and artifacts that feed the next step. If a step cannot produce traceable output, it is not yet operational in RealTimeOS.
Controlled Execution
Faster Throughput
Better Decisions
Lower Risk

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Mini-OS

Mini Operating Systems - Domain Operating Systems

Each Mini-OS is a complete operating system for a business domain. It governs policy and compliance, executes domain-specific processes via Systems and Genies, runs ongoing operational Streams, and generates the facts that Value Engines consume and orchestrate.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
What to Remember
Where It Sits
The domain OS. Controls work, runs processes, feeds facts.Mantra:Domain controls everything.
Why It Matters
Mini-OS is the foundation for the Agentic Factory. It keeps domain capabilities reusable, traceable, and ready to scale.Mantra:Domain first, execution second.
Why This Tab Exists
Defines how a domain works (Systems, Genies, Streams) and stays in-policy. Mantra:One domain pattern. Many uses.
Big Outcome
Same patterns ? consistent work. Same blocks ? standalone or orchestrated. No duplication. Mantra:Build once, use everywhere.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Model Definition
groups.html:
System
Defines policy, risk boundaries, and domain control logic.
Genie
Specialist digital worker for discrete, repeatable tasks.
Stream
End-to-end workflow that routes and closes facts.
Domain OS
A governed operating system for one business domain.
->
Mini-OS as building blocks for Value Engines: Each Mini-OS operates independently (e.g., Finance-OS runs month-end close, HR-OS runs payroll). Value Engines compose Mini-OS capabilities across domains to drive business outcomes (e.g., Order-to-Cash orchestrates Sales-OS, Operations-OS, and Finance-OS).
Example: Order-to-Cash Value Engine Composition
Sales-OS - Create Order (Genie) + order eligibility checks (System)
Operations-OS - Check Inventory (Genie) + allocation logic (System)
Finance-OS - Process Invoice (Genie, can run standalone or in Stream) + receivables system (System)
Finance-OS - Reconcile Payment (Genie) + cash accounting (System)
RTBI - Update Order-to-Cash Dashboard (visibility across all domains)
Each Mini-OS Genie/Stream can execute standalone in its domain OR be orchestrated by the Value Engine. No duplication; reusable building blocks.

groups.label: Infrastructure Layers
groups.html:
Mini-OS
14 domains
Strategy OS?
HR OS?
Legal OS?
Sales OS?
Product OS?
Finance OS?
Admin OS?
LEAN OS?
Marketing OS?
Productivity OS?
Manufacturing OS?
Operations OS?

Mini-OS is the control layer where domain rules are defined and enforced.
Each domain runs its own governed systems, genies, and streams.
Control first keeps all downstream execution in-policy.

groups.label: Design Rationale
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Prompt -> Domain Outcome
Each Mini-OS starts from a clear domain outcome and target.
Context -> Domain Facts
Execution uses live domain facts and operating state.
Intent -> Guardrails
Policy boundaries keep systems, genies, and streams in-bounds.
RealTimeOS Alignment
All Mini-OS instances follow the same control logic.

groups.label: Future-State Model
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Mini-OS Everywhere
Every domain runs as a governed Mini-OS.
Faster Domain Setup
New domains launch faster with reusable control patterns.
Same Rules Everywhere
Policy and risk boundaries stay consistent across domains.
Intent-Correct Factory
Agentic tools stay aligned with operating intent by default.

groups.label: Execution in Chain
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Define Domain Rules
Set policy and risk boundaries first.
Create Agentic Tools
Build systems, genies, and streams to complete domain work.
Run With Live Context
Execution always uses current facts and role context.
Log Governed Outcome
Each result is captured as a governed fact in the loop.

groups.label: Tiny Habits
groups.html:
Think Intent
Lead with Facts
Build Skills
Keep Identities Up to Date
Apply Lessons Learned
Capture Everything

groups.label: Control Dictionary
groups.html:
?
Click any Mini-OS tile below to open domain detail. This registry is the Mini-OS control dictionary.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Human Roles

Human Roles

The Workforce Operating Model starts with people, not agents. Humans set domain law and escalation authority, then route work across Human, Domain Orchestrator/Operator, and Digital execution modes through Mini-OS and Value Engines.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human Roles Overview

groups.label: Human Roles -> Personas -> Advisors -> Operating Roles
groups.html:
Human Roles
Executives / Leaders
Managers / Supervisors
Knowledge Workers
Frontline / Trade / Factory
External Specialists
Personas Virtual-Capable
Strategic Leadership Persona
Operational Leadership Persona
Specialist Execution Persona
Field Execution Persona
External Specialist Persona
Advisors Virtual-Capable
No Advisor (Default)
No Advisor (Default)
No Advisor (Default)
No Advisor (Default)
External Specialist Advisors (Invoked)
Operating Roles
Stakeholders (Owners/Investors)
Domain Orchestrators
Domain Owners
Domain Operators
External Domain Partners
i
Identity separation rule: Personas Virtual-Capable and Advisors Virtual-Capable are separate identity entities in the operating plan. They are not a direct match. A role can have a Persona with no Advisor (e.g., CEO), and Advisors are invoked only when needed. Virtual-Capable means the identity can run as a fully digital role entity, not tied to a 1:1 active human seat.
i
Persona scaling rule: Personas are not required to map 1:1 to human roles. In future operating states, one human executive (for example, CEO) can operate with multiple Virtual-Capable executive personas (CFO, COO, CHRO, and others) as digital role entities.

groups.label: Human Roles - Identity Mirror Inputs
groups.html:
Human Role Persona (Mirror) Advisor (Default) Core Skills
Executives / Leaders Strategic Leadership Persona None (invoke only when needed) Decision Framing, Portfolio Metrics
Managers / Supervisors Operational Leadership Persona Optional (exceptions only) Escalation Rules, Handoff Logic
Knowledge Workers Specialist Execution Persona Optional (domain-specific) Taxonomy, Method Templates
Frontline / Trade / Factory Field Execution Persona Optional (safety/exception) Guided Work, Work Confirmation
External Specialists (Outside Counsel, Tax Advisory, Accountant, Consultant, IT) External Specialist Persona Optional (specialist guidance) Standards Interpretation, Risk Review, Control Validation
Mode Human Seat Persona Model When Used
1:1 Mirror One active human role One matching persona Direct role mirror in current operations.
1:Many Persona Expansion One active human role Multiple virtual personas Future state, e.g., CEO + virtual CFO/COO/CHRO.
Advisory Invocation Optional human requester Advisor entity only when invoked No default assignment; advisor activates on demand.

groups.label: Identities Model - Overview
groups.html:
Identity Entity Purpose Carries Governance
Personas Role-facing interaction model. Views, context, escalation paths, communication style. Policy and decision expression in role behavior.
Advisors Specialist intelligence entity. Playbooks, recommendations, exception guidance. Must align to QMS and standards.
Skills Execution and knowledge capability. Taxonomy, dictionary, templates, task logic. Guardrails inherited from QMS and standards.

groups.label: Advisors - What They Are
groups.html:
Advisor Entity Is Is Not Governance
Domain specialist identity Specialist guidance for facts and exceptions. Not a replacement for human accountability. Aligned to QMS, policy, and audit rules.
Cross-domain advisory entity Specialist capability across multiple contexts. Not owned by one department hierarchy. Boundaries and authority anchored in QMS/standards.
Internal + external role mirror Mirrors inside/outside specialist roles. Not constrained to employee-only roles. Definitions and boundaries anchored to QMS/standards.
Advisor identity instance Attached to a workflow when specialist input is required. Not always-on; not mandatory for every persona. Invocation and accountability stay with operating roles.
i
Advisor mirror rule: Advisors represent both internal and external specialist roles so the operating model can apply the same guidance consistently across legal, accounting, tax, compliance, and related domains.
i
Overview boundary: Human Activity Map, customer experience shift, and productive time-shift analysis are in Tab 04 - Workforce Operating Model.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Workforce Operating Model

Workforce Operating Model

Operating rules for Human Worker, Domain Orchestrator/Operator, and Digital Worker execution in RealTimeOS.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human Roles Overview

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Introduction
groups.html:
Human-First Authority
Human Worker sets the rules and owns escalation.
Identity Bridge
Identities mirror roles so agents act with the right context.
Execution Routing
Work is routed to Human Worker, Domain Orchestrator/Operator, or Digital Worker by risk and policy.
Operating Outcome
Flow of Work is smooth and Cadence is met. Mini-OS + Value Engines are execution layers.
Human Workforce
Sets truth, risk boundaries, and escalation authority.
Domain Operators
Run day-to-day execution and handoffs across systems.
Digital Workforce
Executes deterministic flow, assists judgment work, logs everything.
Bridge to Modes
Execution Modes define when work is Human Worker, Domain Orchestrator/Operator, or Digital Worker.

groups.label: Human Workforce + Identity Mirror (Single View)
groups.html:
Human Workforce Role Domain Operating Role Persona Mirror (1:1 Base) Advisor Default When Advisor Is Invoked
Executives / Leaders Stakeholders Strategic Leadership Persona None High-risk commitments, external specialist validation, board-sensitive decisions
Domain Leads / Managers Domain Owners / Domain Orchestrators Operational Leadership Persona Optional Policy interpretation, compliance edge cases, cross-domain conflicts
Knowledge Workers Domain Operators Specialist Execution Persona Optional Complex analysis, specialist review, non-standard scenario design
Frontline / Field / Trade Domain Operators Field Execution Persona Optional Safety exceptions, customer-critical recovery, unusual on-site conditions
i
Mirror rule: Start with 1:1 persona mirrors for role clarity. Scale to multi-persona per human only after stable operations are proven.
Execution Modes - Who Executes Work

Work is classified by who executes it. This sets routing, automation depth, and SLA. Over time, work moves from Human Worker -> Domain Orchestrator/Operator -> Digital Worker as the Agentic Factory matures.

Digital Worker

Fully autonomous. Agent handles end-to-end with no human in the loop. Deterministic, high-confidence, in-policy.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Genie executes OR Stream runs -> Outcome logged to Digital Twin -> No human involved

Examples
  • Password reset (Genie auto-executes)
  • Patch deployment (Stream orchestrates)
  • Invoice under auto-approval threshold
  • Scheduled report generation
AutonomousNo human loopHigh volume

Domain Orchestrator/Operator

Agent does most execution; human provides judgment or approval at key gates.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Genie/Stream prepares work -> Surfaces decision to human -> Human decides -> Agent completes -> Outcome logged

Examples
  • Expense over threshold (agent validates, human approves)
  • Complex troubleshooting (agent diagnoses, human decides)
  • Contract review (agent flags risks, human confirms)
  • Ambiguous classification (agent scores, human chooses)
Agent + HumanDecision gateQuality control

Human Worker

Human drives end-to-end execution when judgment, relationships, or creativity are required.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Assigned to human -> Human executes (may invoke Genies for research or drafting support) -> Outcome logged

Examples
  • Client escalation requiring empathy
  • Architectural design decisions
  • Sales negotiation
  • Strategic planning
  • Novel problem-solving
Human-ledAgent supportHigh judgment

Key principle: Classification determines execution path, not arrival pattern. An urgent email might be Digital Worker (password reset) or Human Worker (CEO escalation). Work type is about who executes, not when it arrived or how urgent it is.

i
Mini-OS structure moved to dedicated tabs: technical composition, domain registry, and detailed System/Genie/Stream patterns are in Tab 03 Technical and Tab 05 Mini-OS.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Value Engines

Value Engines

Value Engines are cross-cutting commercial capabilities that run across multiple Mini-OS instances simultaneously - driving growth, fulfillment, innovation, and logistics. Where a Mini-OS governs a domain, a Value Engine generates outcomes across domains.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
This tab focuses on outcome execution across domains through Value Engines.
What to Remember
Cross-Domain Engine
Value Engines run outcomes across multiple Mini-OS domains.Mantra:One outcome, many domains.
Outcome First
Each engine is measured by business results, not activity.Mantra:Measure results, not motion.
Shared Building Blocks
One capability can be reused across multiple engines.Mantra:Build once, reuse everywhere.
Always Traceable
Every step logs facts for visibility, control, and learning.Mantra:If it happened, we can prove it.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.
4
Value Engines across all domains
100
Revenue potential vs. traditional models
20 - 40%
COGS reduction per portfolio company
3 - 5
Target fund exit multiples

groups.label: The Four Value Engines - Click to Expand
groups.html:
VE1
VALUE ENGINE 01
Growth Engine
Revenue expansion, market penetration, and customer acquisition across all Mini-OS domains.
?

What it does

The Growth Engine connects Sales OS, Marketing OS, Product OS, and Strategy OS into a unified pipeline converting market signals into pipeline and pipeline into revenue. Every lead, campaign result, and product adoption event becomes a Fact feeding the loop.

Digital workers handle outreach sequencing, pipeline scoring, and campaign optimization. Humans set strategy, approve messaging, and handle relationship-critical moments.

Mini-OS connections

  • Sales OS - pipeline, forecasting, deal velocity
  • Marketing OS - campaign execution, attribution, CAC
  • Product OS - adoption signals, feature feedback
  • Strategy OS - market positioning, OKR alignment
Revenue pipelineCampaign automationDeal intelligence
VE2
VALUE ENGINE 02
Fulfillment Engine
Every committed customer outcome delivered on time, on spec, and within margin.
?

What it does

Connects Operations OS, Services OS, Manufacturing OS, and Logistics Engine into a single delivery pipeline. Every order, service ticket, production run, and shipment is a Fact tracked end-to-end. SLA breaches, capacity shortfalls, and quality events trigger the Agentic Factory instantly.

Mini-OS connections

  • Operations OS - workflow, capacity, resource allocation
  • Services OS - service delivery, SLA management
  • Manufacturing OS - production runs, quality control
  • Logistics Engine - dispatch, tracking, last-mile
End-to-end deliverySLA enforcementZero-gap promise
VE3
VALUE ENGINE 03
Innovation Engine
Systematic discovery, development, and deployment of new capabilities and products.
?

What it does

Connects Product OS, Innovation OS, and Strategy OS to create a governed pipeline from idea to impact. Innovation is not ad hoc - it is a Fact-driven process with measurable inputs, decisions, and outcomes. The Digital Twin enables safe experimentation before committing to live changes.

Mini-OS connections

  • Innovation OS - ideation, experimentation, evaluation
  • Product OS - roadmap, build, release management
  • Strategy OS - alignment, prioritization, OKRs
  • RTBI - scenario modeling, impact forecasting
Structured ideationDigital Twin testingFact-driven R&D
VE4
VALUE ENGINE 04
Logistics Engine
Real-time movement intelligence - supply chain, dispatch, inventory, and last-mile.
?

What it does

Applies the RealTimeOS loop to the physical movement of goods, resources, and people. Every dispatch, transit event, inventory change, and delivery confirmation is a Fact - immediately updating the Digital Twin and triggering Agentic Factory responses.

Mini-OS connections

  • Operations OS - scheduling, routing, resource dispatch
  • Manufacturing OS - inbound materials, outbound finished goods
  • Finance OS - freight costs, supplier payments, landed cost
  • Fulfillment Engine - last-mile, proof of delivery, SLA
Supply chain visibilityAutonomous dispatchInventory intelligence

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - RTBI

RTBI - Real-Time Business Intelligence

RTBI is not a reporting tool bolted onto operations - it is what operations look like when they run correctly on RealTimeOS. Two foundational components (Unified Data and the Digital Twin) make three intelligence components possible (Planning, Analytics, Decisions). You cannot have the top without the bottom.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
This tab focuses on real-time business intelligence as the live decision layer.
What to Remember
Live Data
RTBI runs on live facts, not delayed reports.Mantra:See it now, act now.
One Data Source
Unified Data keeps every team on the same numbers.Mantra:One business, one number.
Full History
The Digital Twin stores what happened and why.Mantra:History explains every decision.
Decision Support
Planning, analytics, and decisions run from the same source.Mantra:Plan, analyze, decide from facts.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.
Foundation Layer - The Infrastructure Intelligence Runs On

groups.label: Intelligence Layer - What the Foundation Makes Possible
groups.html:
These three components are the intelligence outputs - the reason you build the foundation. They move in sequence: Analytics describes what is happening now, Planning uses that to project forward, and Decisions acts on both. Each is only as good as the data and history underneath it.

Analytics
Live dashboards - KPI - Anomaly detection

Real-time dashboards and KPI tracking running directly on the Unified Data layer. Every metric updates the moment a Fact occurs - no refresh cycle, no manual pull. Anomaly detection runs continuously; when something deviates, it generates a new Fact that re-enters the RealTimeOS loop for automatic response.

The end of self-reporting. No one emails a status update because the status is live, visible, and accurate at all times.

PlatformPower BI + Fabric RTI
KPI freshnessReal-time
Self-reporting neededNone
Live KPIsAnomaly detectionFact-backed
?
Planning
Capacity - Demand - Resource - Scenario

Forward-looking projections built from real operational history - not spreadsheet assumptions. Capacity planning answers "can we handle next month's volume given current team and system load?" Demand forecasting answers "what will order volume be in 6 weeks, based on actual patterns?" Scenario modeling runs a proposed change through the Digital Twin before committing.

Planning cycles that took weeks compress to hours. The Digital Twin is the source - every projection is traceable to real Fact history.

Data sourceDigital Twin history
Planning cycleHours not weeks
Horizon7 days -> 12 months
Fact-based forecastsScenario modeling
Decisions
Prescriptive AI - Recommendations - Traceable

The top of the intelligence stack. The Agentic Factory, trained on the full Digital Twin history and informed by live Analytics and Planning data, surfaces the highest-probability-of-success action for each situation. Not describing what happened, not predicting what might happen - prescribing exactly what to do, with the reasoning shown.

Human override is always available and always logged. Every recommendation is traceable back to the Facts that generated it - no black-box outputs.

Intelligence typePrescriptive
ReasoningTraceable - auditable
Human overrideAlways available
Prescriptive AIHuman in loopFull traceability
?
RTBI is not a product add-on. It is the natural emergent capability of running operations correctly on RealTimeOS. Because every event is a Fact and the Digital Twin holds the complete record, intelligence is simply what happens when operations are done right. You don't buy RTBI - you build it by operating correctly.
Health Dashboard - The Real-Time Operations Engine

In a liveoperations environment, RTBI is not a reporting tool you check at scheduled intervals - it is a continuous, event-driven system that watches what's happening RIGHT NOW and automatically triggers the operating cadence whenever attention is required. The Health Dashboard is this system's eyes and ears.

What the Health Dashboard Does

? Live System State

Real-time view of all active Facts: RED incidents (blocked), YELLOW facts (degraded), GREEN work (routine). Updated constantly. Shows age, assignment, and escalation countdown.

Incident & Change Events

Captures any anomaly: alert from Zero Touch AI, Azure Monitor, UniFi. Any deployment, configuration change, or maintenance window. Feeds both as Facts AND as cadence triggers.

? Threshold Violation Detection

Monitors real-time metrics: error rates, response times, queue depths, client response times, team velocity. When a threshold is crossed, auto-escalates the associated fact or spawns a new one.

Pattern & Trend Signals

Watches for secondary patterns: 3 similar incidents in 1 hour, unusual traffic spike, multiple failed transactions from one client, shift handoff gaps. Feeds directly into the Daily Digest and cadence triggers.

Real-Time Cadence Triggers (Not Calendar-Based)

Instead of "check the dashboard at 8:30am", the dashboard itself drives cadence. Here's how events automatically trigger responses:

Incident Event (RED Fact Created)

What Happens
  • Alert fired (Zero Touch, Azure, etc.)
  • Auto-classified as RED (blocked)
  • Assigned to on-call rotation
Cadence Response
  • Teams ping to on-call
  • T+0: Response initiated
  • T+5: Diagnostic summary added to fact
  • T+15: "Status?" check-in if not resolved
  • T+30: Escalation if not progressing

The "cadence" is not a meeting - it's a series of system-driven time-bounded checkpoints.

Change Event (Deploy / Config Change)

What Happens
  • Deployment webhook received
  • Config change tracked
  • Post-deploy monitoring armed
Cadence Response
  • T+0: Change logged to dashboard timeline
  • T+2min: "Smoke check" - any RED facts spawned by this change?
  • T+5min: Metrics delta check - error rate, latency, throughput
  • T+30min: "Still healthy?" dashboard marker
  • If any YELLOW: flag in next Daily Digest

Post-deploy cadence is event-driven, not scheduled. It tightens at +0 to +5min, then relaxes if all green.

Threshold Crossing (Metric Violates SLO)

What Happens
  • Error rate hits 2% (threshold)
  • Response time > 500ms
  • Queue depth > capacity
Cadence Response
  • Dashboard fact created (YELLOW or RED)
  • Trend dashboard shows 5-min window
  • Assigned to domain owner for investigation
  • If sustained > 5min: escalates to incident
  • Auto-logs pattern for Weekly analysis

Metrics-to-cadence: threshold breach = automatic entry into the flow-of-work, not a separate alerting system.

?
The key insight: Unlike traditional cadence which is scheduled (daily standup at 9am, weekly review Friday afternoon), Real-Time cadence is event-driven and time-bounded. Incidents auto-trigger checkpoints at T+5, T+15, T+30. Changes spawn post-deploy watches at T+2, T+5, T+30. Metrics that breach thresholds spawn investigation facts. The system enforces these touches automatically based on what's actually happening.
? Implementation: Analytics + Visual Management

The Health Dashboard is powered by the Analytics component described above - running directly on the Unified Data layer. The actual live dashboard with embedded widgets, real-time updates, and drill-down capability lives in the Visual Management section. This section explains the *why* and *how*; Visual Management shows the *what-it-looks-like*.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Operating Identity

Operating Identity - Personas - Advisors - Skills

The hidden infrastructure powering every Mini-OS and Value Engine. This is where intent engineering becomes operational: Personas carry decision rights and accountability, Advisors carry policy and specialist guidance, and Skills carry reusable methods and guardrails so execution stays consistent and in-bounds.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
What to Remember
Role Mirror
Identities translate human roles into agent-ready context.Mantra:Mirror the real role.
Intent Enforcement
Personas, Advisors, and Skills keep execution in-bounds.Mantra:Rules stay in every step.
Same Language
Shared dictionary and taxonomy keep outputs aligned.Mantra:Use one shared language.
Controlled Autonomy
Agents run with bounded authority and traceable decisions.Mantra:Autonomy with clear limits.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Model Definition
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Task and target
What work is requested and expected output
Prompt
Context Engineering
Execution state
Facts, role context, and current operating conditions
Context
Intent Engineering
Why and boundaries
Policy, risk, accountability, and guardrail boundaries
Intent

groups.label: Infrastructure Layers
groups.html:
Personas
HUMAN ROLES THE SYSTEM MODELS & SERVES
CEOExecutive
COOExecutive
CFOExecutive
Ops ManagerOperations
Warehouse ManagerOperations
Personas
Advisors
SPECIALIST GUIDANCE LAYER
Legal AdvisorLegal
Compliance AdvisorRisk
ISO 9001 AdvisorQuality
LEAN AdvisorEfficiency
Closing AdvisorSales
Advisors

REUSABLE EXECUTION MEMORY
Brand IdentityBrand
DictionaryLanguage
TaxonomyStructure
Job RolesHR
PlaybooksMethod

Personas define how the system presents information and what decisions each role can make. Same data, role-specific view.
Advisors are specialist agents invoked across any Mini-OS. They travel with the operating system, not a department.
Skills are reusable organizational memory. They enforce shared language, structure, and methods.

groups.label: Design Rationale
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Intent -> Personas
Intent defines role posture, decision rights, and accountability by persona.
Intent -> Advisors
Intent sets when specialist guidance is invoked and what policy boundaries apply.
Intent -> Skills
Intent enforces shared language, methods, and guardrails in reusable execution skills.
RealTimeOS Alignment
This is how intent works through RealTimeOS: Personas, Advisors, Skills.

groups.label: Future-State Model
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Identity -> Uses Identities
Every Mini-OS and Value Engine is built on Personas, Advisors, and Skills.
Intent -> Follows Intent
Each System, Genie, and Stream inherits policy, risk, and role boundaries from identities.
Domains -> Same Rules Everywhere
The same intent logic applies across domains, so execution stays predictable and auditable.
Agentic Factory Alignment
RealTimeOS produces an intent-correct Agentic Factory by default, not by manual exception.

groups.label: Execution in Chain
groups.html:
Prompt -> Context -> Intent
Build Identities
Define Personas, Advisors, and Skills first.
Build Systems/Genies/Streams
Create the agentic tools that complete the work.
Identities Are Constant Reference
The work always references identities while it runs.
Intent-Driven Agentic Factory
The outcome is an intent-driven Agentic Factory by default.

groups.label: Tiny Habits
groups.html:
Think Intent
Lead with Facts
Build Skills
Keep Identities Up to Date
Apply Lessons Learned
Capture Everything

groups.label: Control Dictionary
groups.html:
Persona

Role identity that defines decision rights, accountability, and the view of work.

Execution Pattern

Intent set -> Persona loaded -> Role-safe decisions and outputs

Examples
  • CEO persona (strategic decisions)
  • CFO persona (financial controls)
  • Ops Manager persona (daily queue control)
Decision rightsAccountability

Advisor

Specialist identity that provides policy, legal, quality, or risk guidance when invoked.

Execution Pattern

Boundary detected -> Advisor invoked -> Guidance applied -> Trace logged

Examples
  • Legal Advisor for contract exception
  • Compliance Advisor for policy check
  • ISO 9001 Advisor for quality evidence
SpecialistBoundary check

Skill

Reusable execution memory that enforces language, structure, and method consistency.

Execution Pattern

Task starts -> Skill pack applied -> Standardized output produced

Examples
  • Dictionary skill for term consistency
  • Taxonomy skill for entity structure
  • Brand skill for approved voice
ReusableStandardized

Prompt

The requested task and expected output.

Execution Pattern

Request captured -> Output target defined -> Work initiated

Examples
  • Classify this incoming issue
  • Draft a compliant response
  • Prepare closure summary

Context

The facts, role state, policy state, and operating conditions for execution.

Execution Pattern

Facts loaded -> Role context applied -> Boundary checks run

Examples
  • Open facts and current priority
  • Role authority and escalation path
  • Applicable risk policy set

Intent

The reason for the work and the non-negotiable boundaries around how it is done.

Execution Pattern

Intent loaded -> Personas/Advisors/Skills enforced -> Outcome validated

Examples
  • Protect compliance and legal boundaries
  • Preserve brand and communication tone
  • Escalate above approved risk threshold
WhyBoundaries

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Flow of Work

Flow of Work

How work enters the system, gets classified by worker type, gets enriched with dimensions, and flows through execution. This documents both our current manual state and our target agentic state - the workforce maturity path from human-heavy to agent-enabled operations.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
This tab focuses on orchestration logic across human and digital execution.
What to Remember
Facts Enter First
Work starts as facts and is classified before routing.Mantra:No routing without facts.
Right Route, Right Worker
Flow sends work to digital, orchestrator, or human execution.Mantra:Match work to executor.
Clear Handoffs
Each step has ownership, status, and next action.Mantra:No owner, no progress.
Closed-Loop Flow
Completed work returns as new facts for the next cycle.Mantra:Finish work, feed the loop.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Work Classification Framework - Three Worker Types
groups.html:
?
Full definitions in Workforce Operating Model (Tab 06). Worker types, building block definitions (Systems / Genies / Streams), and all 14 Mini-OS structures are documented there. This section shows how classification drives the flow of work.

Digital Worker - Domain Orchestrator/Operator - Human Worker

Work is classified by who/what executes it. This determines routing, automation potential, and SLA expectations. Classification is not static - work progresses from Human -> Domain Orchestrator/Operator -> Digital as the Agentic Factory is built.

Digital Worker

Fully autonomous. Agent handles end-to-end with no human in loop. Deterministic, high-confidence, in-policy.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Genie executes OR Stream runs fully automated -> Outcome logged to Digital Twin -> No human involved

Examples
  • Password reset (Genie auto-executes)
  • Patch deployment (Stream orchestrates)
  • Invoice under auto-approval threshold
  • Scheduled report generation
Autonomous No human loop High volume

Domain Orchestrator/Operator

Agent does heavy lifting, human provides judgment or approval. Collaboration between digital and human workers.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Genie/Stream prepares work -> Surfaces decision to human -> Human decides/approves -> Agent completes -> Outcome logged

Examples
  • Expense over threshold (agent validates, human approves)
  • Complex troubleshooting (agent diagnoses, human decides)
  • Contract review (agent flags risks, human confirms)
  • Ambiguous classification (agent scores, human chooses)
Agent + Human Decision/approval Quality gate

Human Worker

Human drives execution end-to-end. Requires expertise, creativity, relationships, or strategic judgment throughout.

Execution Pattern

Fact arrives -> Assigned to human -> Human executes (may invoke Genies for support tasks like research or drafting) -> Outcome logged

Examples
  • Client escalation requiring empathy
  • Architectural design decisions
  • Sales negotiation
  • Strategic planning
  • Novel problem-solving
Human-led Agent support High judgment

Key principle: Classification determines execution path, not arrival pattern. An urgent email might be Digital Worker (password reset) or Human Worker (CEO escalation). Work type is about who executes, not when it arrived or how urgent it is.

groups.label: Workforce Maturity Model - Current State -> Target State
groups.html:
The Path from Manual to Agentic

Reality check: Today, most work is classified as Human Worker because the Agentic Factory isn't built yet. We're capturing Facts, enriching Dimensions manually, and routing to humans. As we build Genies and Streams, work progresses from Human -> Domain Orchestrator/Operator -> Digital. This workforce maturity model is our agent build roadmap.

Current State (Pre-Agentic)

Human Worker ~95%
Digital Worker ~5%
Domain Orchestrator/Operator ~0%

Almost everything requires manual handling. Only basic scheduled automation (reports, webhooks) runs autonomously. No agent-assist infrastructure exists.

Target State (Post-Agentic)

Digital Worker ~60%
Domain Orchestrator/Operator ~30%
Human Worker ~10%

Most routine work fully automated. Complex work agent-assisted. Only truly judgment-heavy work stays fully manual. Agentic Factory operational.

?
Target metric (Q3 2026): 40% of facts handled by Digital Workers, 30% by Domain Orchestrators/Operators, 30% remain Human Workers. This represents significant progress from current ~95% manual state.

Workforce Maturity Paths - Example Fact Types

Fact TypeCurrent ClassificationTarget ClassificationWorkforce Maturity Trigger (What to Build)Priority
Password reset request Human Worker Digital Worker Build Password Reset Genie (Entra ID API integration) HIGH
Client email inquiry Human Worker Domain Orchestrator/Operator Build Email Classification Genie + Response Drafter Genie -> human reviews before send HIGH
Invoice under $5k Human Worker Digital Worker Build Invoice Validation Genie + Business Central auto-approval workflow MEDIUM
Invoice over $5k Human Worker Domain Orchestrator/Operator Build Invoice Validation Genie + Business Central workflow -> human approval required MEDIUM
Server outage alert Human Worker Domain Orchestrator/Operator Build Diagnostic Stream (gather logs, run health checks) -> surface findings -> human decides recovery action HIGH
Patch deployment Human Worker Digital Worker Build Patch Management Stream (Zero Touch AI + approval rules + maintenance window scheduling) HIGH
Device offline alert Human Worker Digital Worker Build Auto-Remediation Genie (reboot attempt, network check) -> escalate only if failed MEDIUM
Client escalation call Human Worker Human Worker N/A - stays human-led (relationship mgmt, empathy required). Genies provide support (account history lookup, issue summary) N/A
Meeting action items Human Worker Digital Worker Already enabled - Teams Copilot extracts actions -> auto-creates Planner/To Do tasks. Needs refinement. LIVE
License renewal due Human Worker Digital Worker Build License Renewal Stream (Pax8 API check -> auto-renew if in-policy -> notify if exception) MEDIUM
Sales proposal request Human Worker Domain Orchestrator/Operator Build Proposal Generation Genie (template + client data + pricing rules) -> human reviews/customizes -> send LOW
Network device disconnected Human Worker Domain Orchestrator/Operator Build Network Diagnostic Genie (Unifi API check, ping test, log review) -> escalate with context if not auto-resolved MEDIUM

How to use this table: This is the agent build backlog. Start with HIGH priority items that have clear automation paths and high volume. Build the Genie or Stream, test, deploy. Measure: did this fact type migrate from Human -> Digital/Domain Orchestrator/Operator? Track the % distribution monthly to measure Agentic Factory workforce maturity.

groups.label: Event Stream vs Fact Stream - Critical Distinction
groups.html:
Not Every Event Is a Fact

Just because something happened doesn't mean it needs to become a Fact in the RealTimeOS loop. Without this filter, the Fact stream would be overwhelmed with noise - millions of routine events that require no action. We use a two-tier architecture to separate signal from noise.

Event Stream (Tier 1)

Everything that happens. High volume, mostly routine. Stays in source systems (Zero Touch AI, UniFi, Azure Monitor, access control databases).

Examples (NOT Facts)
  • Server receives 10,000 log entries/minute
  • Access control logs 500 badge swipes/day
  • Network heartbeat every 30 seconds
  • Temperature sensor reading every 5 minutes (within range)
  • Successful backup completion (expected)
High volume Routine No action needed

? Fact Stream (Tier 2)

Events that require attention. Low volume, high signal. Enters RealTimeOS loop, gets Dimensions, routed to Workers.

Examples (ARE Facts)
  • Server CPU >90% for 5 minutes -> resource_threshold_exceeded
  • Badge denied 3 times -> access_denied_repeated
  • Device heartbeat missed 10min -> device_offline
  • Temp outside range -> environmental_alert
  • Invoice received -> invoice_received
Low volume Actionable Requires decision

The Promotion Rule: Event -> Fact

An Event becomes a Fact when it meets ANY of these criteria:

  • Threshold crossed - metric outside acceptable range (CPU >90%, disk <10%, response time >2s)
  • Pattern detected - repeated failures, anomaly, unusual sequence (3 failed logins, traffic spike)
  • State change - transition from one state to another (online -> offline, pending -> approved)
  • Business event - transactional event requiring processing (invoice received, order placed, payment due)
  • Human input - any human-generated communication or request (email, call, form, chat, meeting action)
?
Anti-pattern: Do NOT promote routine operational events to Facts. A successful login is not a Fact. A normal temperature reading is not a Fact. A heartbeat ping is not a Fact. These stay in their source systems for compliance, forensics, and historical analysis - but they don't enter the RealTimeOS loop.

groups.label: Fact Type Taxonomy - What Kind of Event Requires Action?
groups.html:
Core Fact Types

When an Event is promoted to a Fact, it gets classified by type. Fact Type determines initial routing logic and typical Worker Type assignment.

Fact TypeDescriptionTypical Worker TypeExamples
EMAIL Written correspondence requiring response Domain Orchestrator/Operator client_inquiry - support_request - vendor_communication
PHONE_CALL Voice conversation requiring action or follow-up Human Worker client_escalation - sales_call - support_call
MEETING Scheduled synchronous conversation (in-person or virtual) Human Worker (actions -> Digital) standup - client_review - planning_session - action_items
CHAT_MESSAGE Instant message requiring response or action Domain Orchestrator/Operator internal_question - quick_request - urgent_notification
ALERT System threshold crossed, requires attention or remediation Digital / Domain Orchestrator/Operator device_offline - disk_full - threshold_exceeded - security_alert
FORM_SUBMISSION Structured data entry requiring processing Digital / Domain Orchestrator/Operator lead_inquiry - feedback - service_request - signup
TRANSACTION Business event requiring processing or approval Digital (if in-policy) / Domain Orchestrator/Operator invoice_received - payment_due - order_placed - po_approval
APPROVAL_REQUEST Explicit request for human authorization Domain Orchestrator/Operator (always) expense_approval - contract_signature - budget_allocation
SCHEDULED_EVENT Time-triggered fact (calendar-driven, not reactive) Digital Worker backup_due - report_generation - license_renewal_reminder
ESCALATION Previously-handled fact now requiring senior attention Human Worker unresolved_ticket - sla_breach - repeated_failure
DELIVERY Physical or digital item arrival confirmation Digital Worker package_delivered - license_key_received - hardware_arrived
DOCUMENT File upload or receipt requiring review/processing Domain Orchestrator/Operator contract_upload - report_submitted - invoice_pdf
MANUAL_ENTRY Human-created task, note, or project Human Worker task - project - initiative - reminder
ANNOUNCEMENT One-to-many broadcast requiring distribution Digital Worker (distribute) / Human (create) policy_change - downtime_notice - company_update

Usage: When a Fact enters the system, it gets tagged with Fact Type + specific event name. Example: ALERT: device_offline or EMAIL: client_inquiry

groups.label: Fact Capture Channels - Where Facts Enter the System
groups.html:
All Channels -> Unified Fact Stream

Every capture channel is an integration point where Events are monitored and Facts are extracted. Some channels deliver Facts directly (email, phone, meeting). Others collect massive Event Streams and only promote threshold-crossing events to Facts (monitoring systems, IoT platforms).

Capture ChannelTool / SystemEvent VolumeFact Types DeliveredCurrent StateTarget State
Outlook Microsoft Outlook ~50-200 emails/day EMAIL, DOCUMENT Manual triage Classification Genie + Response Drafter -> Domain Orchestrator/Operator
Shared Mailboxes support@, sales@, info@ mailboxes ~20-100 emails/day EMAIL, FORM_SUBMISSION Manual monitoring of shared inbox Mailbox rules -> Contact Center queue -> AI triage
Contact Center D365 Contact Center ~10-50 calls/day PHONE_CALL, CHAT_MESSAGE, EMAIL, ESCALATION Manual agent assignment Omnichannel routing + AI triage Genie
Teams Microsoft Teams ~100-300 messages/day MEETING, CHAT_MESSAGE Manual response / Copilot extracts meeting actions Full transcription + action extraction + Q&A Genie
SMS / Text Twilio or MS Communication Services ~0-10 messages/day (if enabled) CHAT_MESSAGE, ALERT (notification delivery) Not currently used SMS gateway -> parse -> route to appropriate queue
Microsoft Forms Microsoft Forms ~5-20 submissions/day FORM_SUBMISSION Power Automate -> email -> manual Auto-route based on form type + response template
Public Website Website contact form, live chat widget ~5-30 submissions/day FORM_SUBMISSION, CHAT_MESSAGE Email notification -> manual response Webhook -> CRM + auto-respond with lead qualification
Social Media LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Facebook ~0-20 mentions/day (if monitored) CHAT_MESSAGE, ESCALATION (public complaint) Not currently monitored Social listening tool -> Dataverse + alert if negative sentiment
Business Central D365 Business Central ~20-100 transactions/day TRANSACTION, APPROVAL_REQUEST, ALERT Workflow -> email -> manual approval Auto-approve if in-policy, Domain Orchestrator/Operator if exception
Zero Touch AI Zero Touch AI RMM ~100k events/day ALERT (20-100 facts/day) Email alert -> manual investigation Auto-remediate (Digital) or escalate with diagnostic log (Domain Orchestrator/Operator)
UniFi Controller Ubiquiti UniFi ~10k events/day ALERT (10-50 facts/day) Not captured (manual portal checks) API integration -> promote threshold-crossing events to Facts
Azure Monitor Azure Monitor + App Insights ~50k events/day ALERT (10-30 facts/day) Email/Teams alert -> manual investigation Service Bus -> Diagnostic Stream -> escalate with context
Azure IoT Hub Azure IoT Hub + IoT Edge ~1M+ events/day (when deployed) ALERT (50-200 facts/day when active) Not deployed (Intelligent Buildings future) Event Hubs -> Stream Analytics -> Facts for env/physical events
Robotics Platform Robot telemetry APIs (vendor TBD) ~100k+ events/day (when deployed) ALERT, TRANSACTION, DELIVERY (20-100 facts/day) Not deployed (no robotics partners yet) Robot API -> IoT Hub -> Facts (task_started, movement_completed, obstacle_detected, task_failed, battery_low)
Barcode / RFID Scanners Warehouse scanners, asset tracking ~1k-10k scans/day (when deployed) TRANSACTION (inventory_movement, asset_checkin) Not deployed (no warehouse ops yet) Scanner -> API -> Business Central + alert if discrepancy
Access Control Physical access system (badge readers) ~500-2k events/day ALERT (access_denied_repeated, unusual_pattern) Standalone system (not integrated) API -> promote only denied/unusual events to Facts
Power Automate Power Automate (flows) Varies by flow SCHEDULED_EVENT, TRANSACTION, ALERT Varies by flow (email, Planner, auto-execute) Orchestration layer - routes to appropriate Workers
Vendor APIs Pax8, Leader, Breeze, Conetix, TelAir ~10-50 events/day TRANSACTION, DELIVERY, ALERT Not captured (manual portal checks) Webhook -> auto-log + notify, escalate if exception
GitHub / DevOps Azure DevOps, GitHub ~20-100 events/day ALERT (build_failed, deployment_complete), DOCUMENT (PR) Email notification -> manual check Webhook -> Teams notification + Planner task if action needed
Calendar Systems Calendly, external calendar invites ~5-20 bookings/day MEETING (scheduled by external party) Email confirmation -> manual calendar add Calendar API integration -> auto-add + prep materials
Payment Gateway Stripe, PayPal, bank APIs ~5-50 transactions/day (if handling payments) TRANSACTION (payment_received, payment_failed, refund_issued) Not currently handling direct payments Webhook -> Business Central + reconciliation alerts
Client ERP / Legacy Systems Client's existing business systems Varies by client integration TRANSACTION, ALERT, DOCUMENT Manual export/import or custom API (varies) Standardized connector -> Dataverse + transformation layer
Voice Assistant / Transcription Phone system IVR, voicemail transcription ~5-20 voicemails/day PHONE_CALL (transcribed), DOCUMENT (voicemail text) Voicemail -> manual callback Transcription -> classification -> route to Contact Center queue
Physical Mail / Courier Manual entry from received physical mail ~2-10 items/day DOCUMENT (physical), DELIVERY (physical package) Someone brings it in -> manual data entry Still manual capture, but logged as Fact (photo + OCR for docs)
Manual Entry Planner, To Do, Loop direct creation ~10-50 entries/day MANUAL_ENTRY Direct entry (no automation) Unchanged (inherently manual creation)

Key insight: Notice the Event Volume column. Channels with high event volume (Zero Touch AI, UniFi, Azure Monitor) collect 10,000 - 100,000+ events/day but only promote 10 - 100 to Facts. Human-input channels (email, phone, forms) have every input become a Fact because human time is inherently valuable - if a human took the time to communicate, it requires attention.

?
Future state - Agentic Fact Ingestion: Every capture channel will have intelligence at the entry point. Email Classification Genie parses and routes. Contact Center Triage Genie assigns to right queue. Business Central Approval Genie auto-approves in-policy transactions. Monitoring Alert Genie attempts auto-remediation before escalating. The human only sees what genuinely requires judgment - everything else flows automatically through the Agentic Factory.

groups.label: Dimension Enrichment - Adding Context to Facts
groups.html:
Traffic Light System - Simple, Objective Classification

Every Fact gets a Traffic Light based on one simple question: "Is someone blocked from doing their job?" No judgment calls. No debating P1 vs P2. Just: blocked, workaround, or routine.

RED - BLOCKED

Someone is completely unable to work RIGHT NOW. No workaround exists.

Examples
  • CEO completely locked out (all devices)
  • Prod database offline
  • Payment gateway down (only payment method)
  • Client's only contact number offline
  • Internet connection down (no backup)
Action

Emergency - interrupt work, page on-call if needed, escalate immediately

YELLOW - WORKAROUND

Degraded or broken, but temporary workaround exists. Business continues inefficiently.

Examples
  • Boardroom AV broken (use laptop screen share)
  • Desktop Outlook broken (Outlook Web works)
  • One printer offline (others available)
  • Network degraded to 50% speed
  • Mobile app broken (desktop works)
Action

Priority - fix today, top of queue, escalates to RED if workaround fails

GREEN - ROUTINE

Normal operations, no one impacted. Routine work, scheduled tasks, requests.

Examples
  • Client inquiry email
  • Feature request
  • Scheduled migration (no users yet)
  • Password reset (user on vacation)
  • Documentation update
Action

Routine - process in queue order, auto-escalates based on timer

Decision Tree - Simple Classification

Is anyone unable to do their core job function?
+- YES -> Can they use a workaround?
+- YES -> YELLOW (degraded but functioning)
+- NO -> RED (completely blocked)
+- NO -> GREEN (routine work)

Escalation Flow - Facts Change Color

Facts can change Traffic Light as situations evolve or time passes:

GREEN -> YELLOW
  • System starts degrading
  • Workaround becomes available
  • Example: Printer fails -> tech enables backup printer nearby
YELLOW -> RED
  • Workaround stops working
  • Too many people affected (workaround doesn't scale)
  • Example: Backup printer also fails -> now RED
GREEN -> RED (skip YELLOW)
  • Escalation timer expires
  • Scheduled deadline hits
  • Example: Boardroom AV broken (GREEN) -> meeting starts in 5min -> RED
RED -> YELLOW
  • Workaround implemented after initial failure
  • Partial restoration of service
  • Example: Primary internet down (RED) -> mobile hotspot working (YELLOW)

Complete Mandatory Dimensions

DimensionValuesHow DeterminedMandatory?
Traffic Light RED (blocked) - YELLOW (workaround) - GREEN (routine) Auto-classified from fact type + keywords + context, manual override available ? Always
Fact Type EMAIL, PHONE_CALL, ALERT, TRANSACTION, MEETING, etc. From capture channel + content analysis ? Always
Source Channel Outlook, Contact Center, Zero Touch AI, UniFi, Business Central, etc. System that delivered the fact ? Always
Worker Type Digital Worker - Domain Orchestrator/Operator - Human Worker Based on fact type + workforce maturity state (current vs target) ? Always
Domain Client Delivery - Internal Ops - Revenue - Product - Support - Finance High-level categorization of work area ? Always
Assigned To Person, role, agent, or queue name Routing decision based on Worker Type + Traffic Light ? Always
Escalation Timer Timestamp or duration until color change Auto-calculated from fact type, client tier, traffic light, context ? Required for GREEN/YELLOW
Client / Project Client name, project ID, or "Internal" From fact context or manual assignment ? Required if Domain = Client Delivery
Client Tier Strategic - Standard - Trial - Internal From CRM/client database ? Required if client work
Location Site/building/zone identifier OR lat/long From device location, user profile, or fact context ? Required for physical/edge facts
Blockers Text description of dependency or waiting state Manual entry or system detection Optional
Value / Revenue Impact $AUD amount or qualitative impact estimate Manual entry or calculated from transaction value Optional
?
Key insight: Traffic Light + Worker Type are the two dimensions that determine routing. Everything else provides context to refine the decision or set escalation timers. Facts cannot be routed without these two mandatory dimensions - everything else can be enriched asynchronously.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Section 02 - OS Framework - Company Cadence

Company Cadence - Agentic Operating Rhythm

The regular rhythm that keeps New Era IT synchronized - but reimagined for an agentic world. Automated summaries replace status meetings. Humans focus on decisions, learning, and strategy. The system tells us what happened; we decide what to do about it.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts -> Dimensions -> Digital Assets -> Agentic Factory -> Digital Workforce -> Digital Twin -> New Fact
RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Human-First
Workforce -> Identities -> Mini-OS -> Value Engines -> RTBI -> Flow of Work -> Cadence
Human-First Operating Chain Scope
This tab focuses on recurring operating rhythm and accountable decision cycles.
What to Remember
Rhythm Creates Control
Cadence turns daily work into repeatable operating discipline.Mantra:Rhythm keeps the system stable.
Automation First
Summaries and signals are generated before meetings start.Mantra:Automate status, protect focus.
Decision Time Matters
People spend time on decisions, not status collection.Mantra:Use people for judgment.
Learn Every Cycle
Each cycle captures lessons and improves the next one.Mantra:Every cycle should improve.

groups.label: Framework Intent Map
groups.html:
Prompt Engineering
Defines what to do and the expected output.Mantra:Say the task clearly.
Context Engineering
Defines how execution runs using facts, role context, and current state.Mantra:Use the right facts.
Intent Engineering
Defines why the work exists and the policy/guardrail boundaries.Mantra:Set the rules first.
Personas + Advisors + Skills
Enforce intent consistently in the Workforce Operating Model.Mantra:Everyone works the same way.

groups.label: Daily Cadence - Automated Digest + Exception Sync
groups.html:
Morning: Automated Daily Digest (No Meeting)

What

Automated summary of current system state delivered to Teams channel + email. Generated by Daily Summary Genie (Domain Orchestrator/Operator).

When & Where

Time: 8:30 AM AEST (before work starts)
Delivered to: Teams "Daily Digest" channel + email

Digest Contents

  • RED Facts - All currently blocked facts (count, assigned to, age)
  • YELLOW Facts escalating soon - Facts that will become RED today if not addressed (with countdown timers)
  • ? Closed yesterday - Count by Worker Type (Digital/Domain Orchestrator/Operator/Human)
  • Blockers requiring coordination - Facts tagged with blockers that need team help (not just "waiting on external")
  • Trends - Pattern detection (e.g., "password resets up 40% this week", "3 network slow reports from same location")
  • System Opportunities - Repeated exception and process-pattern signals detected for automation and hardening
?
No meeting required. Team reads digest async. If you see something urgent, ping in Teams or grab the fact. Otherwise, just awareness of current state.

When Needed: Exception Sync (Only If Blockers Require Coordination)

Trigger

Daily Summary Genie detects =1 blockers requiring team coordination (not just external dependencies).

Format

Time: 9:00 AM AEST
Duration: 10 minutes max
Location: Teams call

Agenda

  1. Review blockers from digest (already pre-read)
  2. Assign coordination actions (who unblocks whom)
  3. Done

Rule: If no coordination blockers in the digest -> no meeting that day. Team just reads digest and gets to work.

groups.label: Weekly Cadence - Automated Retrospective + Strategic Review
groups.html:
Friday Morning: Automated Weekly Summary (No Meeting)

What

Comprehensive weekly retrospective with metrics, patterns, lessons learned, and system opportunities. Generated by Weekly Summary Genie (Domain Orchestrator/Operator).

When & Where

Time: Friday 8:00 AM AEST
Delivered to: Teams channel + Loop "Weekly Reviews" workspace

Summary Contents

  • Volume Metrics - Facts captured, closure rate, Worker Type distribution vs target
  • Traffic Light Distribution - RED/YELLOW/GREEN fact counts, average resolution times
  • RED Fact Analysis - All RED facts this week, categories, resolution outcomes
  • Repeat Patterns (Lessons Learned) - Facts that happened 3+ times (automation or root cause fix candidates)
  • Automation Opportunities - Agent build candidates ranked by volume + current Worker Type
  • Projects & Commitments - Status of active projects, on-track / at-risk / blocked
  • Strategic Client Health - Each Strategic/Standard client: RED/YELLOW/GREEN health indicator
  • Workforce Maturity Progress - % of facts by Worker Type, Genies deployed, next build targets
?
Pre-read required. Team reads this summary before Friday afternoon Strategic Review. Comes to the meeting with context, ready to decide.

Friday Afternoon: Strategic Review - 60 minutes - 2:00 PM AEST

This is the only weekly meeting. Humans make decisions based on the automated summary. No status reporting - everyone already read the summary. Just decisions, learning, and planning.

Agenda (60 minutes)

1. Lessons Learned Review (15min)

Review "Repeat Patterns" from summary. Decide: Fix root cause? Build automation? Accept as normal? Assign actions.

2. Automation Roadmap (15min)

Review "Automation Opportunities" from summary. Decide: Which Genies/Streams to build next week? Update workforce maturity backlog priority.

3. Strategic Client Review (15min)

Any YELLOW or RED clients? Proactive outreach needed? Escalations or risks? System opportunities requiring priority action?

4. Next Week Commitments (10min)

What are the P1 deliverables for next week? Any capacity constraints? Any strategic bets or new initiatives?

5. Blockers & Decisions (5min)

Anything that can't wait until Monday? Quick decisions needed?

Output

Loop page with: Lessons learned + actions, Automation roadmap updates, Client action items, Next week commitments. Shared with entire team post-meeting.

groups.label: Monthly Cadence - Automated Business Review + Direction Setting
groups.html:
Last Friday Morning: Automated Monthly Summary (No Meeting)

What

Comprehensive business review with financials, client portfolio health, RealTimeOS workforce maturity metrics, and system opportunities. Generated by Monthly Summary Genie (Domain Orchestrator/Operator).

When & Where

Time: Last Friday 9:00 AM AEST
Delivered to: Loop "Monthly Direction" workspace

Summary Contents

  • Financial Metrics - MRR, growth rate, burn rate, runway, on-track status for $50k MRR target
  • Client Portfolio - Active client count, tier distribution, health status, churn, pipeline
  • RealTimeOS Workforce Maturity Progress - Worker Type distribution vs target, Genies deployed, pace vs Q3 goal
  • Operational Metrics - Fact volume, Traffic Light distribution, resolution times, trends
  • Month Trends & Patterns - What improved? What degraded? What emerged?
  • System Opportunities - Exception clusters, bottlenecks, missing-fact patterns, and roadmap acceleration candidates

Last Friday Afternoon: Monthly Direction Review - 90 minutes - 2:00 PM AEST

Leadership team reviews monthly summary and makes strategic direction decisions. This is where pivots happen, resource allocation changes, and big bets are made or killed.

Agenda (90 minutes)

TopicTimeKey Questions
Financial Review 20min On track to $50k MRR by mid-2026? Burn vs runway healthy? Any pivot needed?
Client Portfolio Review 20min Health of existing clients? Pipeline for new clients? Path to 5 active by end-2026?
RealTimeOS Progress Review 20min Workforce maturity velocity adequate? Which Mini-OS/Value Engines shipped? Roadmap adjustments?
Strategic Decisions 20min New system opportunities (from summary)? Resource allocation changes? Pivots or new bets?
Next Month Priorities 10min Top 3 objectives for the month ahead? Resource commitments?
Output

Loop page with: Monthly OKRs, Strategic decisions made, Resource allocation changes, Top 3 priorities for next month. Shared with board/advisors if applicable.

groups.label: Quarterly Cadence - Strategic Planning (Still Manual)
groups.html:
Quarterly Planning Session - Half day - 2 weeks before quarter end

Set OKRs for the next quarter. Review progress on strategic anchors ($50k MRR, 5 clients, fund readiness). Align team on priorities. Allocate capacity. This stays manual - strategy can't be fully automated.

OKR setting Capacity planning Strategic alignment Resource allocation

Output: Loop page with Q[N] OKRs, priority initiatives, and resource commitments. Shared with entire team. Reviewed monthly for progress in Monthly Direction Review.

groups.label: Annual Cadence - Operating Plan (Still Manual)
groups.html:
Annual Planning Session - Full day offsite - December

Set the strategy and operating plan for the next year. Review RealTimeOS roadmap. Confirm strategic anchors. Plan hiring / capacity. Set financial targets. Update Statement of Direction if needed. This stays manual - long-term strategy requires deep human judgment.

Annual strategy Operating plan Financial model Capacity plan RealTimeOS roadmap

Output: Full operating plan document (Word or Loop). Shared with board/advisors. Becomes the reference doc for the year. Sets the context for all quarterly and monthly planning.

groups.label: What Gets Automated vs What Stays Human
groups.html:
? AUTOMATED (Genies Do This)

  • Status compilation - what's open, closed, blocked
  • Metrics calculation - resolution times, volumes, distributions
  • Pattern detection - repeat issues, trends, anomalies
  • Opportunity identification - client requests, automation candidates
  • Report generation - daily digest, weekly summary, monthly review
  • Client health scoring - RED/YELLOW/GREEN based on fact patterns

HUMAN (We Decide This)

  • Lessons learned interpretation - what do patterns mean?
  • Automation roadmap prioritization - which Genie to build next?
  • Strategic client decisions - proactive outreach, escalation handling
  • Resource allocation - who works on what, hiring decisions
  • Direction setting - pivots, new bets, strategic focus
  • OKR definition - what are we committing to achieve?
?
The agentic cadence principle: Humans don't compile information - agents do. Humans don't report status - the system does. Humans make decisions, learn from patterns, and set direction. The cadence exists to create regular decision points, not status updates. If a meeting is just reporting what everyone already knows, automate it.
